data.name: SITESETTINGS_ALLOW_NEW_REGISTRATION_DESCRIPTION
data.value: Check this to allow users register themselves. Leave blank for register through User Manager only.

data.name: SITESETTINGS_ALT_THEME_DESCRIPTION
data.value: 替换配色方案可用应用于模块。

data.name: SITESETTINGS_COUNTRY_FILTER_DESCRIPTION
data.value: Allowed countries limits country list in RegisterFull page, select 'World' for no filter.

data.name: SITESETTINGS_LANGLIST_DESCRIPTION
data.value: This is a list of the languages that the site will support,it's in format <UI-Culture>=<Formatting-Culture>.

data.name: SITESETTINGS_LOGO_DESCRIPTION
data.value: Enter the name of logo file here.

data.name: SITESETTINGS_PAGE_KEY_PHRASE_DESCRIPTION
data.value: This setting can be used by a module or by a control. It allows you to define a common message for the entire portal e.g. Welcome to x portal! This can be used for search engine optimisation. It allows you to define a keyword rich phrase to be used throughout your portal.

data.name: SITESETTINGS_PAGE_LAYOUT_DESCRIPTION
data.value: Specify the site level page layout here.

data.name: SITESETTINGS_PAGE_META_DESCRIPTION_DESCRIPTION
data.value: This setting is to help with search engine optimisation. Enter a default description (Not too long though. 1 paragraph is enough) that describes your portal.

data.name: SITESETTINGS_PAGE_META_ENCODING_DESCRIPTION
data.value: Every time your browser returns a page it looks to see what format it is retrieving. This allows you to specify the default content type.

data.name: SITESETTINGS_PAGE_META_KEYWORDS_DESCRIPTION
data.value: This setting is to help with search engine optimisation. Enter 1-15 Default Keywords that represent what your site is about.

data.name: SITESETTINGS_PAGE_META_OTHERS_DESCRIPTION
data.value: This setting allows you to enter new tags into the Tab / Page's HEAD Tag. As an example we have added a portal tag to identify the version, but you could have a meta refresh tag or something else like a css reference instead.

data.name: SITESETTINGS_PAGE_TITLE_DESCRIPTION
data.value: Allows you to enter a default tab / page title (Shows at the top of your browser).

data.name: SITESETTINGS_PAGE_URL_KEYWORD_DESCRIPTION
data.value: This setting is not fully implemented yet. It was to help with search engine optimisation by allowing you to specify a default keyword that would appear in your url.

data.name: SITESETTINGS_REGISTER_TYPE_DESCRIPTION
data.value: Choose here how Register Page should look like.

data.name: SITESETTINGS_SHOW_MODIFIED_BY_DESCRIPTION
data.value: Check to show by whom the module is last modified.

data.name: SITESETTINGS_TERMS_OF_SERVICE_DESCRIPTION
data.value: Type here a file name used for showing terms and condition in each register page. Provide localized version adding _<culturename>. E.g. Terms.txt, will search for Terms.txt and for Terms_en-US.txt

data.name: SITESETTINGS_THEME_DESCRIPTION
data.value: Specify the site level theme here.

data.name: MODULESETTINGS_APPLY_THEME_DESCRIPTION
data.value: Check this box to apply theme to this module

data.name: MODULESETTINGS_CULTURE_DESCRIPTION
data.value: Choose culture. Invariant cultures shows the module always.

data.name: MODULESETTINGS_SHOW_PRINT_BUTTION_DESCRIPTION
data.value: Show print button in view mode?

data.name: LANGUAGESWITCHER_CUSTOMFLAGS_DESCRIPTION
data.value: Check this if you want to use custom flags from portal's images folder. Custom flags are located in portal folder. /images/flags/

data.name: LANGUAGESWITCHER_FLAGS_DESCRIPTION
data.value: Select here how flags should look like.

data.name: LANGUAGESWITCHER_TYPES_DESCRIPTION
data.value: Select here how your language switcher should look like.

data.name: ACCESS_DENIED_MESSAGE
data.value: Either you are not currently logged in, or you do not have access to this tab page within the portal. Please contact the portal administrator to obtain access.

data.name: ALLOWNEWREGISTRATIONS_DESCRIPTION
data.value: Check this to allow users register themselves. Leave blank for register through User Manager only.

data.name: ALREADY_REGISTERED1
data.value: If you already have an account

data.value: Set a custom layout for this tab only

data.value: Set a custom alternate theme for the modules in this tab only

data.name: DIRECTURL
data.value: A direct url that can be used to logon automatically

data.name: DONOTRESENDWITHIN_DESCRIPTION
data.value: To avoid spam and duplicate sent you cannot email an user more than one time in specifed number of days.

data.name: EDIT_ACCESS_DENIED_MESSAGE
data.value: Either you are not currently logged in, or you do not have access to modify the current portal module content. Please contact the portal administrator to obtain edit access for this module.

data.value: Set title for English (United States) culture.

data.value: Unable to load theme %1%. Default not available

data.value: Move selected item up in list

data.value: Thank you and we hope you enjoy your visit to

data.name: TAB_DELETE_FAILED
data.value: Delete failed. Please delete all modules in a page and all linkded tab before delete a tab.

data.name: TABKEYPHRASE_DESCRIPTION
data.value: This setting can be used by a module or by a control. It allows you to define a common message for the entire portal e.g. Welcome to x portal! This can be used for search engine optimisation. It allows you to define a keyword rich phrase to be used throughout your portal.

data.name: TABMETADESCRIPTION_DESCRIPTION
data.value: This setting is to help with search engine optimisation. Enter a default description (Not too long though. 1 paragraph is enough) that describes your portal.

data.name: TABMETAENCODING_DESCRIPTION
data.value: Every time your browser returns a page it looks to see what format it is retrieving. This allows you to specify the default content type.

data.name: TABMETAKEYWORDS_DESCRIPTION
data.value: This setting is to help with search engine optimisation. Enter 1-15 Default Keywords that represent what your site is about.

data.name: TABMETAOTHER_DESCRIPTION
data.value: This setting allows you to enter new tags into the Tab / Page's HEAD Tag. As an example we have added a portal tag to identify the version, but you could have a meta refresh tag or something else like a css reference instead.

data.name: TABTITLE_DESCRIPTION
data.value: Allows you to enter a default tab / page title (Shows at the top of your browser).

data.name: TABURLKEYWORD
data.value: A Default Keyword To Identify all Tabs / Pages

data.name: TABURLKEYWORD_DESCRIPTION
data.value: This setting is not fully implemented yet. It was to help with search engine optimisation by allowing you to specify a default keyword that would appear in your url.

data.value: Type here a file name used for showing terms and condition in each register page. Provide localized version adding _<culturename>. E.g. Terms.txt, will search for Terms.txt and for Terms_en-US.txt

data.value: Use Test Mode for testing your settings. It will send only one email to the address specified as sender. Useful for testing

data.name: USER_MESSAGE1
data.value: Users must be registered to view secure content.

data.name: USER_MESSAGE2
data.value: Users may add themselves using the Register form, and Administrators may add users to specific roles using the Security Roles function above.

data.name: USER_MESSAGE3
data.value: This section permits Administrators to manage users and their security roles directly.

data.name: USER_MESSAGE_DOMAIN1
data.value: Domain users do not need to be registered to access portal content that is available to 'All Users'

data.name: USER_MESSAGE_DOMAIN2
data.value: Administrators may add domain users to specific roles using the Security Roles function above.

data.name: USER_MESSAGE_DOMAIN3
data.value: This section permits Administrators to manage users and their security roles directly.

data.name: USERBLOCK_DESCRIPTION
data.value: Select the maximum number of users. For sending emails to all you have to repeat the process. Use small values to avoid server timeouts.
